Class EncodePostNet

java.lang.Object
EncodePostNet
public class EncodePostNet extends Object
EncodePostNet class for encoding ZIP, ZIP+4, and ZIP+4+Delivery codes into POSTNET barcodes.

  • Constructor Details

    • EncodePostNet

      public EncodePostNet()
      Constructor for EncodePostNet. Initializes zipCode as an empty string.

  • Method Details

    • encodeZipCode

      public static String encodeZipCode(String zipCode)
      Encode a ZIP code into a POSTNET barcode. This method takes a ZIP code string as input, calculates the check sum, and encodes the ZIP code into a binary representation using the predefined binary encodings from ENCODE and StringBuilder.
      Parameters:
      zipCode - The ZIP code string to be encoded.
      Returns:
      The binary representation of the ZIP code.

    • binaryToBarCode

      public static String binaryToBarCode(String binaryString)
      Convert a binary string representation to a POSTNET barcode string. This method takes a binary string as input and converts it into a POSTNET barcode string by replacing '0' with '.' for a half bar and '1' with '|' for a full bar.
      Parameters:
      binaryString - The binary string to be converted.
      Returns:
      The POSTNET barcode representation of the binary string

    • getBarCode

      public static String getBarCode(String zipCode)
      Get the POSTNET barcode for given ZIP code. This method encodes the provided ZIP code and returns its POSTNET barcode representation. This method utilizes the encodeZipCode and binaryToBarCode methods.
      Parameters:
      zipCode - The ZIP code to generate the bar code for.
      Returns:
      The POSTNET barcode representation of the ZIP code as a string.

    • getZipCode

      public static String getZipCode()
      Getter for getting the currently set ZIP code. This method returns the zipCode string currently stored in the class
      Returns:
      zipCode as a string

    • setZipCode

      public static void setZipCode(String zipCode)
      The setter for setting the zip code. This method checks for a valid zip code entry. Zip code must be 5, 9, or 11 digits long. If valid, zipCode is set to provided value. If not valid, zipCode gets set as a default "11111" value.
      Parameters:
      zipCode - zipCode string to set
